image_1.entity_name: Neural Network Based Task-Oriented Dialogue System
image_1.description: The neural network based task-oriented dialogue system is designed for end-to-end optimization for natural language understanding, dialogue state tracking, and dialogue policy learning.
image_1.reason: The image depicts the architecture of a task-oriented dialogue system that integrates multiple neural network components such as Bi-LSTM Utterance Encoder, LSTM Dialogue State, and Natural Language Generator. This matches the description of a neural network based task-oriented dialogue system in the text.

This aligns with the description of the dialogue policy in the text, which is responsible for selecting the next system action based on the current dialogue state.

image_4.description: Dialogue State Tracking is the process of estimating the user's goal from the dialogue and is central to the system's functionality.
image_4.reason: The image depicts a table labeled 'Table 1: Dialogue state tracking results on DSTC2', which provides detailed accuracy metrics for various goal slots in dialogue state tracking tasks. The text also mentions the evaluation of dialogue state tracking results on DSTC2 and the movie booking corpus, aligning with the content of the table.

image_5.description: A metric used to evaluate the performance of the model, indicating the proportion of successful dialogues.
image_5.reason: The image is a line graph showing the task success rate over time for different models. The x-axis represents the number of interactive dialogue learning sessions, and the y-axis represents the task success rate. The curves represent the performance of different models: SL Baseline, SL + RL, SL + IL 500 + RL, and SL + IL 1000 + RL. The task success rate is clearly depicted in the graph, making it the most relevant entity.

image_6.description: Dialogue Turn Size is a metric that measures the number of turns in successful dialogues, indicating the efficiency of the model.
image_6.reason: The image depicts a line graph showing the average turn size over time for different models. The text mentions that the SL + RL model can handle easy tasks with fewer turns, resulting in a lower average turn size. This aligns with the concept of dialogue turn size as a metric for evaluating model efficiency.

image_7.description: Dialogue State Tracking Accuracy is the evaluation metric used to measure the model's ability to track dialogue states, with results showing improvement through imitation learning.
image_7.reason: The image depicts a line graph titled 'Average DST Accuracy over Time (smoothed)', which directly corresponds to the concept of Dialogue State Tracking Accuracy. The graph shows the performance of different models over time in terms of DST accuracy, which aligns with the text discussing the improvements in DST accuracy through various learning methods.
